title: PLAZA / ANNETTE
description: Daughter of the book shop clerk is standing outside with a small book stand in order to make the shop more inviting. You chat her up.

dialogueTree.title: Annette: ""Hi, ace detective." She smiles war..."
dialogueTree.text: "Hi, ace detective." She smiles warmly. "Are you here for more books?"

links.title: You: ""Say, child... *you* wouldn't happe..."
links.text: "Say, child... *you* wouldn't happen to know a good fridge, would you?"

links.title: Annette: ""A fridge?""
links.text: "A fridge?"

links.title: You: ""Yes. Like a big, big fridge a cop..."
links.text: "Yes. Like a big, big fridge a cop could put a dead body into."

links.title: Annette: ""Hah!" She smiles. "You mean like t..."
links.text: "Hah!" She smiles. "You mean like the ice bear fridge? Man, that's scary."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ice bear fridge?""
links.text: "Ice bear fridge?"

links.title: Annette: ""Yes. Like a bear, but white. There..."
links.text: "Yes. Like a bear, but white. There's a fridge below the building, in the basement." She points underground. "With red glowing eyes. I went back there once. Behind the bookstore..."

links.title: Annette: "She lowers her voice. "Mum doesn't..."
links.text: She lowers her voice. "Mum doesn't want me to go there anymore. Not that I want to. It was pretty scary.

links.title: You: ""And there's a big fridge there?""
links.text: "And there's a big fridge there?"

links.title: Annette: ""Yes." She smiles."
links.text: "Yes." She smiles.

links.title: You: ""I can't understand how I didn't no..."
links.text: "I can't understand how I didn't notice a giant ice bear fridge myself..."

links.title: Annette: "The girl shrugs cheerfully: "Well,..."
links.text: The girl shrugs cheerfully: "Well, it is pretty dark in there..."

links.title: Annette: ""Anyway..." She looks around again,..."
links.text: "Anyway..." She looks around again, her nose red from the cold.

links.title: You: ""One more thing. How do I get insid..."
links.text: "One more thing. How do I get inside the building?"

links.title: Annette: ""Um... that's a problem. The only w..."
links.text: "Um... that's a problem. The only way in is through the bookstore, but my mum is pretty strict about not letting anyone in."

links.title: Annette: ""But, I don't know, you're a *polic..."
links.text: "But, I don't know, you're a *police man*..." She says it with admiration, eyeing you up and down. "Maybe you can convince her somehow?"

links.title: You: ""One more thing. How do I get insid..."
links.text: "One more thing. How do I get inside the building? I already talked to your mom, but she's not letting anyone in."

links.title: Annette: ""Um... she can be pretty strict, yo..."
links.text: "Um... she can be pretty strict, you're right about that. I don't really know what to say. You could try sneaking in?" She smiles shyly, like she's not sure it's the right answer.

links.title: Annette: ""I'm sorry, sir, I really don't kno..."
links.text: "I'm sorry, sir, I really don't know."

links.title: You: ""Ice bear fridge?""
links.text: "Ice bear fridge?"

links.title: You: ""What are you doing now?""
links.text: "What are you doing now?"

links.title: Annette: ""Math..." She looks into her notebo..."
links.text: "Math..." She looks into her notebook with trepidation. "It's really difficult. Like -- really. They say you need it to get rich. Better than standing outside in the cold, I guess."

links.title: Annette: ""Oh, oh...!" Suddenly, she smiles a..."
links.text: "Oh, oh...!" Suddenly, she smiles and perks up. "I found something while you were away."

links.title: You: ""What is it?""
links.text: "What is it?"

links.title: Annette: ""I thought this would fit you... Li..."
links.text: "I thought this would fit you... Like thanks for helping out! Not me -- the city I mean. Like a detective does." She gives you a hat -- almost exactly like the one Dick Mullen wears on the covers.

links.title: You: ""Wait, where did you get it?""
links.text: "Wait, where did you get it?"

links.title: Annette: ""Just what Dick Mullen would ask!"..."
links.text: "Just what Dick Mullen would ask!" She lowers her voice. "I got it from behind the curtains. I'm not really supposed to go there..."

links.title: You: ""It's a... fedora?""
links.text: "It's a... fedora?"

links.title: Annette: ""Maybe? It's the hat Dick Mullen we..."
links.text: "Maybe? It's the hat Dick Mullen wears all the time..." She grins with joy. "You'll look way more serious with that."

links.title: Annette: ""Right. I have to get back to my ho..."
links.text: "Right. I have to get back to my homework now, before Mum notices. Man, this is *hard*..." She looks back at the infernal scribblings under her nose.

links.title: You: ""A detective hat?""
links.text: "A detective hat?"

links.title: Annette: ""Yes! Just like the one Dick Mullen..."
links.text: "Yes! Just like the one Dick Mullen wears all the time..." She grins. "You'll look way more serious with that."

links.title: You: ""Okay, I get it. I can look just li..."
links.text: "Okay, I get it. I can look just like Dick Mullen -- except I'm an actual police officer."

links.title: Annette: ""Yes!" She grins. "I bet it looks g..."
links.text: "Yes!" She grins. "I bet it looks good on you. Really serious."

links.title: You: ""Little girl, help. My Dick Mullen..."
links.text: "Little girl, help. My Dick Mullen book ripped before I could get to the end. Do you know what happens?"

links.title: Annette: ""Which book was it, sir?""
links.text: "Which book was it, sir?"

links.title: You: ""Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Ident..."
links.text: "Dick Mullen and the Mistaken Identity."

links.title: Annette: ""Oh..." She frowns. "I'm very sorry..."
links.text: "Oh..." She frowns. "I'm very sorry, sir. I haven't read that one yet. I wish I could help you."

links.title: You: ""Hey, guess what. I found a way int..."
links.text: "Hey, guess what. I found a way into the Doomed Commercial Area."

links.title: Annette: ""Oh, that's great!" Her smile is wa..."
links.text: "Oh, that's great!" Her smile is warm. "I hope exciting adventures lie ahead! And maybe you can help mother become... less afraid."

links.title: You: ""What is your name?""
links.text: "What is your name?"

links.title: Annette: ""My name is Annette, sir. My mum, h..."
links.text: "My name is Annette, sir. My mum, her name is Plaisance, she owns the store. She's inside, minding the register... or organizing the stock." The girl gazes at the window, then suddenly jolts, her eyes wide, as if recalling something:

links.title: Annette: ""Feel free to step in and browse ou..."
links.text: "Feel free to step in and browse our wares!"

links.title: You: ""And you're standing out here in th..."
links.text: "And you're standing out here in the cold because...?"

links.title: Annette: ""I'm signalling that the store is o..."
links.text: "I'm signalling that the store is open." She nods eagerly. "Otherwise people might not know... they'd miss out on the *Crime, Romance, and Biographies of Famous People*."

links.title: Empathy: "A sudden gush of wind turns the pag..."
links.text: A sudden gush of wind turns the pages of the books on the counters. She covers her face, smiling, but she's cold.

links.title: You: ""You're cold. Can I help in some wa..."
links.text: "You're cold. Can I help in some way?"

links.title: Annette: ""Kind of you to offer, sir..." She..."
links.text: "Kind of you to offer, sir..." She doesn't know what else to say.

links.title: Empathy: "What could you do to help her anywa..."
links.text: What could you do to help her anyway?

links.title: You: ""I should have a word with the stor..."
links.text: "I should have a word with the store-owner, maybe?"

links.title: Annette: ""Oh, no-no, sir! I'm happy to help..."
links.text: "Oh, no-no, sir! I'm happy to help Mum by luring in customers!" She stands upright and smiles like a little soldier. "Besides, I have some hot juice in my vacuum bottle to keep warm."

links.title: You: ""Such a good trooper you are, alrea..."
links.text: "Such a good trooper you are, already learning the value of hard work." (Pat her head.)

links.title: Annette: ""Thank you, sir! I'm happy to help..."
links.text: "Thank you, sir! I'm happy to help Mum out with the store." She smiles and stands upright like a little soldier.

links.title: You: ""I could help -- by brutally disman..."
links.text: "I could help -- by brutally dismantling the free market."

links.title: Annette: ""Thank you, sir! I'm glad to help M..."
links.text: "Thank you, sir! I'm glad to help Mum out with the store." She doesn't seem to understand what you said.

links.title: You: ""Okay, I guess I will.""
links.text: "Okay, I guess I will."

links.title: Annette: ""Mhm!" She stamps her feet, waiting..."
links.text: "Mhm!" She stamps her feet, waiting for you to say something.

links.title: You: ""Shouldn't you be at school or some..."
links.text: "Shouldn't you be at school or something?"

links.title: Annette: ""I do my studies at home at the mom..."
links.text: "I do my studies at home at the moment. I have to help Mum keep this place running."

links.title: You: ""Isn't going to school more importa..."
links.text: "Isn't going to school more important than... this?"

links.title: Annette: ""Mum says it's necessary to do both..."
links.text: "Mum says it's necessary to do both, because it builds character. Mum says a proper worker is dutiful -- that's how you get ahead in life, you succeed."

links.title: Composure: "There is stress and unease behind t..."
links.text: There is stress and unease behind these words. She's reciting etiquette.

links.title: You: ""How's the business going?""
links.text: "How's the business going?"

links.title: Annette: ""Mum says it's peachy. She was a li..."
links.text: "Mum says it's peachy. She was a little afraid at first, there's talk about this house being..." She looks over her shoulder. "Cursed."

links.title: Inland Empire: "Behind her the window has been boar..."
links.text: Behind her the window has been boarded up. You sense the boards creaking, twisting for a second... and some kind of *doubt* in her tense shoulders.

links.title: You: ""Cursed? In what way?""
links.text: "Cursed? In what way?"

links.title: Annette: ""Cursed in a way that makes them sa..."
links.text: "Cursed in a way that makes them say that no business has ever really thrived here, sir. That they all go..." She's looking for the right word...

links.title: You: ""Bankrupt.""
links.text: "Bankrupt."

links.title: Annette: ""Exactly. But we've been doing fine..."
links.text: "Exactly. But we've been doing fine so far."

links.title: You: ""I've been in this house and you're..."
links.text: "I've been in this house and you're right, there's an awful lot of failed businesses there."

links.title: Annette: ""You've been there?" Her eyes go wi..."
links.text: "You've been there?" Her eyes go wide. "My mum never lets me sneak around in the back room or the cellar!"

links.title: Annette: ""This must have been really scary....."
links.text: "This must have been really scary..." She looks at her freezing hands, before hiding them in her coat sleeves.

links.title: You: ""I'm currently investigating the cu..."
links.text: "I'm currently investigating the curse on your mother's behalf."

links.title: Annette: "Annette's eyes go wide: "She let yo..."
links.text: Annette's eyes go wide: "She let you in there? Usually she doesn't let anyone sneak around in the back rooms or the cellar."

links.title: Annette: ""I hope you can help her. Help her..."
links.text: "I hope you can help her. Help her become less afraid or something..." She looks at her freezing hands, before hiding them in her coat sleeves.

links.title: You: ""Your mother told me about the curs..."
links.text: "Your mother told me about the curse, but she wouldn't let me investigate."

links.title: Annette: ""Yes, she can be quite strict about..."
links.text: "Yes, she can be quite strict about it." Annette nods. "My mum doesn't let anyone sneak around in the back rooms or the cellar."

links.title: You: ""I don't think curses are real.""
links.text: "I don't think curses are real."

links.title: Annette: ""They shouldn't be, but they seem r..."
links.text: "They shouldn't be, but they seem real. Anyhow, they say that these grounds are doomed for businesses."

links.title: Rhetoric: "There must be an economic reason fo..."
links.text: There must be an economic reason for this.

links.title: You: ""One could say that entire economie..."
links.text: "One could say that entire economies are doomed, as they tend to crash every once in a while."

links.title: Annette: ""Yes... sir." You realise she doesn..."
links.text: "Yes... sir." You realise she doesn't have the faintest idea what you're talking about.

links.title: You: ""You know, the economy, it's like....."
links.text: "You know, the economy, it's like... the network of everyone buying and selling and producing and consuming and stuff."

links.title: Annette: ""Why are they doing that?""
links.text: "Why are they doing that?"

links.title: You: ""Because that keeps the network......"
links.text: "Because that keeps the network... working... right."

links.title: Annette: ""Okay, I understand, sir!" She look..."
links.text: "Okay, I understand, sir!" She looks puzzled.

links.title: Empathy: "She doesn't really understand, but..."
links.text: She doesn't really understand, but says so to make you feel better about yourself. Your explanation was garbage anyway.

links.title: You: ""The economy is about the rich expl..."
links.text: "The economy is about the rich exploiting the poor as much as they can."

links.title: Annette: ""Why would they do that?""
links.text: "Why would they do that?"

links.title: You: ""Greed, my child. It's always greed.""
links.text: "Greed, my child. It's always greed."

links.title: Annette: ""That's not nice at all." She frown..."
links.text: "That's not nice at all." She frowns.

links.title: You: ""Because it's the nature of the pow..."
links.text: "Because it's the nature of the powerful to exploit the weak."

links.title: You: ""You have to spend money to make mo..."
links.text: "You have to spend money to make money, see."

links.title: Annette: ""If you say so, sir!" She smiles, p..."
links.text: "If you say so, sir!" She smiles, perhaps a bit too eagerly.

links.title: You: ""The economy is all about trust, ok..."
links.text: "The economy is all about trust, okay."

links.title: Annette: ""That makes sense, sir!" She nods,..."
links.text: "That makes sense, sir!" She nods, perhaps a bit too eagerly.

links.title: You: ""It's just regular trading and sell..."
links.text: "It's just regular trading and selling of things, child. It doesn't work out for most people."

links.title: Annette: ""Of course, sir. Uhm..." She doesn'..."
links.text: "Of course, sir. Uhm..." She doesn't know what else to say.

links.title: You: ""They're not doomed. But your mothe..."
links.text: "They're not doomed. But your mother should learn from their mistakes."

links.title: You: ""This sounds rather serious. I shou..."
links.text: "This sounds rather serious. I should probably... look into this."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We can go into the bookstore and a..."
links.text: "We can go into the bookstore and ask about the case, but I don't see much more to look *into* here." The lieutenant makes a note in his notebook.

links.title: Annette: ""Yes!" She chirps. "Please do also..."
links.text: "Yes!" She chirps. "Please do also look at our wares inside -- the postcards and board games are there, sir."

links.title: You: ""What do you know about the other f..."
links.text: "What do you know about the other failed businesses?"

links.title: Annette: ""Nothing really, sir. Mum doesn't a..."
links.text: "Nothing really, sir. Mum doesn't allow me to sneak around in the back rooms or the cellar." She looks a bit disappointed. "I don't really know what's there."

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Did someone say *sneak around in th..."
links.text: Did someone say *sneak around in the cellar*? We should do that.

links.title: You: ""How does this curse... manifest it..."
links.text: "How does this curse... manifest itself?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It does not *manifest* itself in a..."
links.text: "It does not *manifest* itself in any way. It does not exist. I liked it better when we were talking about whether it's appropriate to stand out in the freezing weather."

links.title: You: ""But Kim... the plasmic manifestati..."
links.text: "But Kim... the plasmic manifestations..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No such thing." The lieutenant sta..."
links.text: "No such thing." The lieutenant stands at your side, stern and serious.

links.title: You: ""Fine. I'll show you!""
links.text: "Fine. I'll show you!"

links.title: Annette: ""Uh..." The girl looks back and for..."
links.text: "Uh..." The girl looks back and forth between you two. "Anything else you wanted to talk about, sir?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It does not *manifest* itself in a..."
links.text: "It does not *manifest* itself in any way. It does not exist."

links.title: Annette: ""Uh... I'm not sure, sir. I don't r..."
links.text: "Uh... I'm not sure, sir. I don't really know anything about curses..." She looks around, confused.

links.title: Annette: "Her eye lands on the sign on the wi..."
links.text: Her eye lands on the sign on the window that says *Crime, Romance, and Biographies of Famous People*. She brightens up and points to it: "But I do know books! We can talk about books."

links.title: You: ""Hmm-hmm." (Stroke your chin.) "Eno..."
links.text: "Hmm-hmm." (Stroke your chin.) "Enough about the curse... for now."

links.title: Annette: "Annette looks at your shaved, prick..."
links.text: Annette looks at your shaved, prickly chin. It distinctly contrasts with the oily mutton chops that surround it. "Maybe I can tell you about some of our books instead?"

links.title: You: ""Ass up.""
links.text: "Ass up."

links.title: Annette: ""I wouldn't really say it like that..."
links.text: "I wouldn't really say it like that... but I guess so." She blushes.

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Annette: ""Well... they run out of money and..."
links.text: "Well... they run out of money and have to stop doing business."

links.title: You: ""Good to hear that it's going well...."
links.text: "Good to hear that it's going well. I'm sure there's nothing to worry about."

links.title: You: ""School is stupid. You're lucky not..."
links.text: "School is stupid. You're lucky not to be there."

links.title: You: ""What is *school* anyway?""
links.text: "What is *school* anyway?"

links.title: Annette: ""School?" She rubs her red, chilled..."
links.text: "School?" She rubs her red, chilled nose. "Well, mine is a big yellow building on Boogie Street. And the people there run it. They say it's a *charity*."

links.title: Shivers: "The gale wind blows in from the coa..."
links.text: The gale wind blows in from the coast, a wind of needles. It wraps itself around a building of brick and mortar. Somewhere, a clamor rings through the honeycomb of classrooms.

links.title: You: "What is this feeling?"
links.text: What is this feeling?

links.title: Shivers: "Remorse. The parquet of assembly ha..."
links.text: Remorse. The parquet of assembly halls, the rows of stall bars are growing cold. The corridors stand empty. A girl's voice somehow finds its way through this strange feeling...

links.title: Shivers: "You haven't heard a word of what sh..."
links.text: You haven't heard a word of what she's been saying these past few moments. You only hear...

links.title: You: "Discard thought."
links.text: Discard thought.

links.title: Annette: "She sways slowly side-to-side, her..."
links.text: She sways slowly side-to-side, her wide eyes fixed at you standing there, silently, like a weirdo.

links.title: You: ""What is this crime business?!""
links.text: "What is this crime business?!"

links.title: Annette: ""Crime fiction is about murders or..."
links.text: "Crime fiction is about murders or burglaries or things like that. And the work of a policeman or a private detective who's trying to solve a crime and catch the criminals."

links.title: You: ""Wait -- not crime *fiction*. I nee..."
links.text: "Wait -- not crime *fiction*. I need to know what *crime* is."

links.title: Annette: ""Uh..." She doesn't know what to sa..."
links.text: "Uh..." She doesn't know what to say.

links.title: You: ""It's that bad." (Point to your hea..."
links.text: "It's that bad." (Point to your head.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Crime is a deviation from the law..."
links.text: "Crime is a deviation from the law punishable by either a civil or criminal sentencing. It's what *The Law* prevents."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Crime is what we were solving befo..."
links.text: "Crime is what we were solving before this conversation began."

links.title: Annette: ""Crime is what criminals do. And po..."
links.text: "Crime is what criminals do. And policemen... solve?"

links.title: You: ""Why would anyone want to *read* ab..."
links.text: "Why would anyone want to *read* about crime?"

links.title: Annette: ""It's exciting to people, I guess...."
links.text: "It's exciting to people, I guess. They get to imagine dangerous things. And it's kinda like a puzzle, where you can guess who the criminal is or how the good guys are going to catch him. "

links.title: You: ""I'm a policeman myself, by the way.""
links.text: "I'm a policeman myself, by the way."

links.title: Annette: ""You don't look much like a policem..."
links.text: "You don't look much like a policeman." She examines you, as if to find something policeman-like.

links.title: You: ""Huh, well what does a cop look lik..."
links.text: "Huh, well what does a cop look like then?"

links.title: Annette: ""Didn't mean to offend, sir, sorry,..."
links.text: "Didn't mean to offend, sir, sorry, sir. It's just that you don't look like Dick Mullen." She points to a book cover, on which you see a strapping Vespertine officer. He stands grimly over the body of a dead woman.

links.title: You: ""I used to be exactly like that Mul..."
links.text: "I used to be exactly like that Mullen guy. Then I decided to *live a little*."

links.title: Annette: ""What's that mean?""
links.text: "What's that mean?"

links.title: You: ""Uh, you know -- cut loose, raise h..."
links.text: "Uh, you know -- cut loose, raise hell, blow off steam."

links.title: Annette: ""And everything's better now, sir?""
links.text: "And everything's better now, sir?"

links.title: You: ""I don't know.""
links.text: "I don't know."

links.title: Annette: ""Why is that?""
links.text: "Why is that?"

links.title: You: ""Look at me! A hideous beast, a fai..."
links.text: "Look at me! A hideous beast, a failure of a cop. A disgrace."

links.title: Annette: ""Sir, please, sir, don't say things..."
links.text: "Sir, please, sir, don't say things like that. You look... nice enough."

links.title: You: ""Nice enough for a small child, sur..."
links.text: "Nice enough for a small child, sure... maybe."

links.title: Annette: ""Don't be sad, sir." She seems genu..."
links.text: "Don't be sad, sir." She seems genuinely concerned. "I'm sorry I said that thing about Dick Mullen."

links.title: You: ""A man can *never* be truly happy w..."
links.text: "A man can *never* be truly happy with who he is."

links.title: Annette: ""Oh. Okay." She blinks at you, not..."
links.text: "Oh. Okay." She blinks at you, not knowing how to reply. "I shouldn't have said that thing about Dick Mullen..."

links.title: You: ""You'll understand when you're olde..."
links.text: "You'll understand when you're older."

links.title: You: ""No.""
links.text: "No."

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: Annette: ""That's great, sir!" She smiles ent..."
links.text: "That's great, sir!" She smiles enthusiastically.

links.title: You: ""You know, nobody actually looks li..."
links.text: "You know, nobody actually looks like the guy in the picture. That's just a stupid fantasy of a man."

links.title: Annette: "She looks at Dick Mullen, frowning."
links.text: She looks at Dick Mullen, frowning.

links.title: Empathy: "Dark, arrogant, violent. Likely ove..."
links.text: Dark, arrogant, violent. Likely overcompensating for something.

links.title: Endurance: "That's not a healthy look. Muscles..."
links.text: That's not a healthy look. Muscles get bigger, heart grows weaker.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Check out the pose -- rigid as a st..."
links.text: Check out the pose -- rigid as a stick. He couldn't even wipe his own ass. You don't want to be like that.

links.title: Conceptualization: "He isn't even drawn right."
links.text: He isn't even drawn right.

links.title: You: ""He isn't even drawn right. This is..."
links.text: "He isn't even drawn right. This is not how human shoulders work, the perspective is all wrong."

links.title: Annette: "She examines the picture, trying to..."
links.text: She examines the picture, trying to find whatever is wrong with it. She then shrugs and puts the book aside, unconvinced.

links.title: You: ""That's just no way to *cop*." I ca..."
links.text: "That's just no way to *cop*." I can do it way better than Dick Mullen."

links.title: Annette: ""Sure you can, sir." She smiles mis..."
links.text: "Sure you can, sir." She smiles mischievously. "He's just a fictional character, he'll be no match for you."

links.title: Annette: ""Maybe you can show me some *real*..."
links.text: "Maybe you can show me some *real* police work, sir? Like in the books!" The cover image of Dick Mullen seems to stare at you with harsh disapproval.

links.title: You: ""Muscle training is flower arrangin..."
links.text: "Muscle training is flower arranging for men. I bet he thinks he's real manly like that. He isn't. It's just unhealthy."

links.title: Annette: "She examines the picture closely. T..."
links.text: She examines the picture closely. The Vespertine detective exhibits few signs of health or unhealth.

links.title: You: ""Poor vitality is no way to *cop*,..."
links.text: "Poor vitality is no way to *cop*, little girl. I could take him down easy."

links.title: Annette: ""Sure you could, sir." She smiles m..."
links.text: "Sure you could, sir." She smiles mischievously. "He's just a fictional character, he's no match for your strength."

links.title: You: ""Bet he can't even bend over to pic..."
links.text: "Bet he can't even bend over to pick the gun his rigid fingers dropped. Real detectives are sinewy and snake-hipped. Like me."

links.title: Annette: "She's trying to examine the shadow-..."
links.text: She's trying to examine the shadow-obscured hips of Dick Mullen. "They don't look rigid to me..."

links.title: You: ""Mobility is the proper way to *cop..."
links.text: "Mobility is the proper way to *cop*, girl. Dick Mullen can't compete with my hip-grind."

links.text: Then why does all of this feel like some sad, strange dream?

links.text: She gazes at the image of Dick Mullen, frowning. "Nooo, he's wicked smart in the stories."

links.text: "Sure, when the author does all the thinking for him. Real policemen have to think and act on their own."

links.text: "Like you, sir, of course." She smiles mischievously. "He's just a fictional character, he's no match for you."

links.text: "No, I meant your *mind*."

links.text: "But that's like... the same thing." She squints her eyes, trying to solve this puzzle.

links.text: "In the eyes of a kid, maybe. The difference between me and Mullen is vast. He's nothing!"

links.text: "If you say so, sir." She smiles mischievously. "He's just a fictional character, he's no match for you."

links.text: "Uh, not really, sir."

links.text: "See, that's what reading those fakey-fake Mullen books gets you. Now you're dealing with a real cop."

links.text: "That's right. A real *failure*."

links.title: Annette: "Her eyes shine with sympathy. "Chee..."
links.text: Her eyes shine with sympathy. "Cheer up, sir. No need to compare yourself to a fictional character."

links.text: "Maybe you can show me some *real* deductive police work, sir? Like in the books!" Her smile is warm and consoling, unlike the imperial image of Dick Mullen.

links.title: You: ""Overshadowed by a fake man? That's..."
links.text: "Overshadowed by a fake man? That's harsh."

links.title: Annette: "She looks at you with sympathy. "Ch..."
links.text: She looks at you with sympathy. "Cheer up, sir. It's much easier being a fictional character, he doesn't have to deal with... real things."

links.text: "I don't really want to DEAL with this. It's too much."

links.title: Annette: "She looks at you with sympathy. "We..."
links.text: She looks at you with sympathy. "We can talk about something else if you want. Something nicer."

links.title: You: ""Hmm... I actually had other questi..."
links.text: "Hmm... I actually had other questions."

links.title: Annette: ""More about books, maybe?" Annette..."
links.text: "More about books, maybe?" Annette nods eagerly.

links.title: You: ""Okay, then maybe I'm not a policem..."
links.text: "Okay, then maybe I'm not a policeman? Or should stop being one."

links.title: You: ""Okay, I get it. Crime-murder gets..."
links.text: "Okay, I get it. Crime-murder gets the people going."

links.title: Annette: ""Mhm-mhm," she replies. "And it's k..."
links.text: "Mhm-mhm," she replies. "And it's kinda like a puzzle, too. You can guess who the criminal is or how the good guys are going to catch him."

links.title: You: ""What is romance?""
links.text: "What is romance?"

links.title: Annette: ""It's the type of book where there'..."
links.text: "It's the type of book where there's a rich lady and she has to choose between the good man and the bad man." She smiles at the thought, perhaps imagining herself in that situation.

links.title: Annette: ""Or there could be a story about a..."
links.text: "Or there could be a story about a poor lady getting a rich man. It's about man and lady business, sir."

links.text: "What about a poor man getting a rich lady?"

links.title: Annette: ""It happens. But usually the guy ge..."
links.text: "It happens. But usually the guy gets rich in the process, or should actually be rich himself, but has lost his family property unjustly, like during the Revolution or something."

links.title: You: ""I see.""
links.text: "I see."

links.title: Annette: ""Those are unhappy books, for most..."
links.text: "Those are unhappy books, for most of the pages. People sad about what they have lost. But then it all turns out just fine in the end!"

links.title: You: ""What about when both of the men ar..."
links.text: "What about when both of the men are bad?"

links.title: Annette: ""These are not very common. You can..."
links.text: "These are not very common. You can't have a choice between bad and bad, nobody wants to read a story like that."

links.title: You: ""What if it's written really well?""
links.text: "What if it's written really well?"

links.title: Annette: ""Well... maybe then it's fine. Mayb..."
links.text: "Well... maybe then it's fine. Maybe if the lady then decides not to pick either, because she doesn't need a bad man. Yes, that would be interesting!"

links.title: You: ""What about when everyone is poor?""
links.text: "What about when everyone is poor?"

links.title: Annette: ""That's really not a proper romance..."
links.text: "That's really not a proper romance story. That's more like everyday life!"

links.title: You: ""Sometimes you have to write about..."
links.text: "Sometimes you have to write about real life things."

links.title: Annette: ""Not in romance books, sir. These a..."
links.text: "Not in romance books, sir. These are about nice and pretty people, and everyone is happy in the end."

links.title: You: ""Yeah, poor people are boring.""
links.text: "Yeah, poor people are boring."

links.title: Annette: ""I guess, yes. People in books are..."
links.text: "I guess, yes. People in books are always very interesting. Especially the romance-people."

links.title: You: ""What about a book where the *man a..."
links.text: "What about a book where the *man and lady business* doesn't work out at all?"

links.title: Annette: ""I haven't read many of... those. M..."
links.text: "I haven't read many of... those. Maybe you should ask Mum?"

links.title: You: ""Yeah? You think she has one about..."
links.text: "Yeah? You think she has one about an *excruciatingly painful* breakup?"

links.title: Annette: ""I don't think it's a romance story..."
links.text: "I don't think it's a romance story if the main characters break up, though..." She pauses, trying to figure out the appropriate answer.

links.text: "No-no, think about it! One where they plunge into a torrid spiral of pain and recrimination. Only it's *really long* and drawn out. Scarred for life. Phantom limb!"

links.title: Annette: ""Ummm... no? I don't know..." She l..."
links.text: "Ummm... no? I don't know..." She looks at you with puzzlement.

links.text: You can take this! Blossom like a pain-flower.

links.text: "Yeah. Yeah! And it drags on for *years* and *years* with no resolution in sight..."

links.text: The girl is at a loss for words.

links.title: You: ""... each of you filling with resen..."
links.text: "... each of you filling with resentment and bitterness for having *ruined* each other's lives..."

links.text: She shifts and sways on her feet, looking confused and uncomfortable.

links.text: Stop. There's no need for this. It's in your power to change the subject.

links.text: It's time to leave it be. You're about to make a child cry. Are you proud of yourself?

links.title: You: "Not a single shred of pride remains..."
links.text: Not a single shred of pride remains in me.

links.title: Volition: "This is your *tiny* chance for rede..."
links.text: This is your *tiny* chance for redemption. Apologize.

links.text: Right. Activate Denial Mode.

links.text: You're not really an automaton, you do know that?

links.text: Damn right I am! Proud as the Lion of Serber.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Wonderful.""
links.text: "Wonderful."

links.title: Annette: "Her eyes grow wide as she tries to..."
links.text: Her eyes grow wide as she tries to comprehend the outburst. "I'm sorry, sir?"

links.text: "You heard me! I'm full of pride and I ready to talk about books. Let's do this."

links.text: "I... uh... don't worry, little girl. Got a bit carried away there. Let's back up out of this."

links.text: "On second thought, this seems like an inappropriate topic to discuss with children."

links.title: Annette: ""Mhm!" She nods enthusiastically, o..."
links.text: "Mhm!" She nods enthusiastically, obviously relieved.

links.title: You: ""Doesn't ring a bell? Alright, I'll..."
links.text: "Doesn't ring a bell? Alright, I'll ask your mom."

links.title: Annette: ""Yes!" She nods, relieved. "She kno..."
links.text: "Yes!" She nods, relieved. "She knows books, definitely."

links.text: What *was* that? An idea for an unfinished novel stuck somewhere in your fore-brain?

links.title: Volition: "You clearly have issues you need to..."
links.text: You clearly have issues you need to address.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Later when you get the chance, you..."
links.text: Later when you get the chance, you should address these issues -- by getting *drunk*. That'll show them!

links.title: You: ""Okay.""
links.text: "Okay."

links.title: Annette: ""Sometimes they break up for a litt..."
links.text: "Sometimes they break up for a little while, but then they always get back together."

links.title: You: ""Maybe I will.""
links.text: "Maybe I will."

links.title: Annette: ""Mhm. I'm sure she can help out!" S..."
links.text: "Mhm. I'm sure she can help out!" She smiles wide. "Anything else you're curious about?"

links.title: You: ""That's enough romance for me. I ha..."
links.text: "That's enough romance for me. I had other questions."

links.title: Annette: ""Maybe some about other books?" She..."
links.text: "Maybe some about other books?" She rubs her chilled nose with her fist.

links.title: You: ""Who are these... famous people?""
links.text: "Who are these... famous people?"

links.title: Annette: ""Oh, kings and queens and generals..."
links.text: "Oh, kings and queens and generals of old, or artists and writers, or musicians, those kinds of people. There's usually something extraordinary about them." She scratches her cold-reddened cheek, then continues:

links.title: Annette: ""I think that's why people read the..."
links.text: "I think that's why people read them. To find the secrets of their fame."

links.title: Logic: "Seems like most people who read tho..."
links.text: Seems like most people who read those books fail to get more famous from reading them.

links.title: You: ""Reading those doesn't make the rea..."
links.text: "Reading those doesn't make the readers more famous, does it?"

links.title: Annette: ""But it does make the famous people..."
links.text: "But it does make the famous people more famous!" She smiles gleefully.

links.title: Half Light: "They're all dorks."
links.text: They're all dorks.

links.title: You: ""Fame sounds delicious. Maybe someo..."
links.text: "Fame sounds delicious. Maybe someone will write a book about me one day."

links.title: Annette: ""Why would they do that, sir?""
links.text: "Why would they do that, sir?"

links.title: You: ""Because I'll be a superstar cop, i..."
links.text: "Because I'll be a superstar cop, in the papers and everything! That'll show 'em."

links.title: Annette: ""That's so cool! Maybe they'll make..."
links.text: "That's so cool! Maybe they'll make you a book cover picture and everything! Standing over a dead body, holding a gun..."

links.title: You: ""Hmm... why indeed? I'm just an old..."
links.text: "Hmm... why indeed? I'm just an old, tired cop. What use am I?"

links.title: Annette: ""You're not that old... maybe you'l..."
links.text: "You're not that old... maybe you'll do something really important. Something that *wows the world*!"

links.title: You: ""You think so?""
links.text: "You think so?"

links.title: Annette: ""Yes! There's hope... a lot of famo..."
links.text: "Yes! There's hope... a lot of famous people got famous late, or even after they died."

links.title: Inland Empire: "Yeah, you're certainly the type who..."
links.text: Yeah, you're certainly the type who might find fame *posthumously*. Who knows, you might even get famous for the *manner* of your death!

links.title: You: ""That sounds like a nice story to t..."
links.text: "That sounds like a nice story to tell yourself at night. Maybe fame isn't that important after all."

links.title: Annette: ""Maybe not! No one *needs* a book w..."
links.text: "Maybe not! No one *needs* a book written about them anyway." She grins. "It's always better to read books!"

links.title: You: ""Some can't get noticed, others can..."
links.text: "Some can't get noticed, others can't get properly forgotten. That's life for you."

links.title: Annette: ""I think you just have to live a ha..."
links.text: "I think you just have to live a happy life!" She rubs her nose. "No need to worry about fame or think bad thoughts!"

links.title: You: ""But what if I get famous only thro..."
links.text: "But what if I get famous only through dying? I couldn't enjoy the fame at all."

links.title: Annette: ""I don't think you should live life..."
links.text: "I don't think you should live life with that fear." She stamps on her feet. "Just try to be the best you can!"

links.title: You: ""Thanks, girl. You are very kind.""
links.text: "Thanks, girl. You are very kind."

links.title: Annette: ""Yes, sir!" She smiles and takes a..."
links.text: "Yes, sir!" She smiles and takes a sip from her vacuum bottle.

links.title: You: ""Fame is... for vain people. I have..."
links.text: "Fame is... for vain people. I have better things to do."

links.title: Annette: ""Okay, sir!" She stamps her feet, w..."
links.text: "Okay, sir!" She stamps her feet, waiting for what comes next.

links.title: You: ""These famous people sound like a b..."
links.text: "These famous people sound like a bunch of dorks."

links.title: Annette: "Annette's expression remains ever s..."
links.text: Annette's expression remains ever so helpful, but she doesn't say anything.

links.title: You: ""Yeah, you heard me. Only losers wa..."
links.text: "Yeah, you heard me. Only losers waste their time with that garbage."

links.title: Annette: ""Isn't that kind of a childish thin..."
links.text: "Isn't that kind of a childish thing for a grown-up to say?"

links.title: Conceptualization: "When she grows up, and if she grows..."
links.text: When she grows up, and if she grows up to be clever, she'll discover there's no such thing as a 'grown-up.'

links.title: Half Light: "These people deserve to *die*."
links.text: These people deserve to *die*.

links.title: You: ""If you grow up to be clever, you'l..."
links.text: "If you grow up to be clever, you'll discover there's no such thing as a 'grown-up.'"

links.title: Annette: ""Okay... sir.""
links.text: "Okay... sir."

links.title: Empathy: "She doesn't know what to make of th..."
links.text: She doesn't know what to make of that. But she'll remember it.

links.title: You: ""What makes you think I'm grown up?""
links.text: "What makes you think I'm grown up?"

links.title: Annette: ""You look all wrinkly and hairy, li..."
links.text: "You look all wrinkly and hairy, like an old person!"

links.title: Endurance: "You also *feel* old: tired, hardly..."
links.text: You also *feel* old: tired, hardly able to catch your breath, your joints aching constantly.

links.title: You: ""Hrm! I'm not that old, I'm doing j..."
links.text: "Hrm! I'm not that old, I'm doing just fine, thank you very much."

links.title: Annette: ""If you say so, sir!" She beams you..."
links.text: "If you say so, sir!" She beams you a piercing smile.

links.title: You: ""Yeah, I'm old. That's just what ha..."
links.text: "Yeah, I'm old. That's just what happens to people."

links.title: Annette: ""I wonder how I'll be when I get ol..."
links.text: "I wonder how I'll be when I get old..." She mumbles. "Maybe I'll also get all wrinkly..." She giggles to herself.

links.title: You: ""I look *Harry*? That can't be me,..."
links.text: "I look *Harry*? That can't be me, not *Harry* -- what are you talking about?"

links.title: Annette: ""Hairy, sir. I said hairy. Covered..."
links.text: "Hairy, sir. I said hairy. Covered with hair..." She sways on her feet, puzzled.

links.title: You: ""Maybe...?""
links.text: "Maybe...?"

links.title: Annette: "She gives you a quizzical look, not..."
links.text: She gives you a quizzical look, not understanding the reasoning behind your odd outbursts.

links.title: You: ""Maybe I should start *killing* the..."
links.text: "Maybe I should start *killing* these famous people. Hunt them down."

links.title: Annette: ""Sir?!" She looks at you, eyes wide..."
links.text: "Sir?!" She looks at you, eyes wide in shock.

links.title: You: ""They *deserve* punishment for all..."
links.text: "They *deserve* punishment for all the things they had to do get so famous."

links.title: Annette: ""Okay..." She coughs. "Maybe buy so..."
links.text: "Okay..." She coughs. "Maybe buy some books then?"

links.title: You: ""So I can absorb their *essence*. A..."
links.text: "So I can absorb their *essence*. All their fame will flow into me."

links.title: Annette: ""I don't think that's how fame work..."
links.text: "I don't think that's how fame works, sir..."

links.title: You: ""Haha, never mind, girl. I'm quite..."
links.text: "Haha, never mind, girl. I'm quite the joker. I would never do something like that."

links.title: Annette: ""That's not a funny joke. At all.""
links.text: "That's not a funny joke. At all."

links.title: You: ""Never mind... I literally had noth..."
links.text: "Never mind... I literally had nothing else to say."

links.title: Annette: ""Okay!" She looks at you with her w..."
links.text: "Okay!" She looks at you with her wide eyes.

links.title: You: ""Right, I had a different question..."
links.text: "Right, I had a different question in mind."

links.title: You: ""Can I become famous by reading one..."
links.text: "Can I become famous by reading one of those books?"

links.title: Annette: ""I don't know about that... But I i..."
links.text: "I don't know about that... But I imagine life is great when you're famous."

links.title: You: ""Who is that?" (Point to the woman..."
links.text: "Who is that?" (Point to the woman browsing books.)

links.title: Annette: ""Oh, that's auntie Billie. She's ni..."
links.text: "Oh, that's auntie Billie. She's nice, if a bit distressed."

links.title: You: ""She's your aunt?""
links.text: "She's your aunt?"

links.title: Annette: ""No-no, sir. She's a working woman..."
links.text: "No-no, sir. She's a working woman who comes to look at the books a lot."

links.title: You: ""Why is she distressed?""
links.text: "Why is she distressed?"

links.title: Annette: ""I think she has a bad husband. Not..."
links.text: "I think she has a bad husband. Not very nice or helpful."

links.title: You: ""You can stop calling me 'sir.' I a..."
links.text: "You can stop calling me 'sir.' I am but a working man."

links.title: Annette: ""No, sir, I can't. It would be too..."
links.text: "No, sir, I can't. It would be too tiring to refrain from it. It's already tiring enough to remember to say it all the time. It's nice of you to say I could stop, though."

links.title: You: ""I get you. I, for example, can't s..."
links.text: "I get you. I, for example, can't stop making this face." (Point at your face.)

links.title: Annette: ""That's a friendly enough face, mos..."
links.text: "That's a friendly enough face, most of the time."

links.title: You: ""Okay, yeah, when the next person c..."
links.text: "Okay, yeah, when the next person comes, you'd have to 'sir' or 'ma'am' them again."

links.title: Annette: ""Yes... sir." She smiles apologetic..."
links.text: "Yes... sir." She smiles apologetically.

links.title: You: ""'Sir' it is, then. Soldier on.""
links.text: "'Sir' it is, then. Soldier on."

links.title: Annette: ""By your command!""
links.text: "By your command!"

links.title: You: ""Okay, I'm going to *deduce* someth..."
links.text: "Okay, I'm going to *deduce* something now."

links.title: Composure: "The girl keeps her hands folded, hi..."
links.text: The girl keeps her hands folded, hidden. Why is that?

links.title: You: ""Hey... Why do you keep your hands..."
links.text: "Hey... Why do you keep your hands folded?"

links.title: Annette: ""What do you mean, sir?" She looks..."
links.text: "What do you mean, sir?" She looks wary.

links.title: Empathy: "She knows where this is going."
links.text: She knows where this is going.

links.title: You: ""You don't need to be worried. I'm..."
links.text: "You don't need to be worried. I'm here to help."

links.title: Annette: "She looks around anxiously. Her han..."
links.text: She looks around anxiously. Her hands remain folded in front of her. She doesn't want to show them.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant stands by -- looking..."
links.text: The lieutenant stands by -- looking at the two of you with little interest.

links.title: Empathy: "A façade of true professionalism. H..."
links.text: A façade of true professionalism. He is far more intrigued by the situation than his poise reveals.

links.title: You: ""It's okay.""
links.text: "It's okay."

links.title: You: ""You heard me. Hands up.""
links.text: "You heard me. Hands up."

links.title: You: ""You can show them to me.""
links.text: "You can show them to me."

links.title: You: ""Actually, I'd rather not deduce an..."
links.text: "Actually, I'd rather not deduce anything. Every time I deduce people get hurt."

links.title: Annette: "She sighs -- not relieved, but resi..."
links.text: She sighs -- not relieved, but resigned. "No," she says. "You're right..."

links.title: Annette: "She brings out her reddened hands -..."
links.text: She brings out her reddened hands -- her nails are frayed, nearly chewed down to the flesh.

links.title: You: ""You bite your nails.""
links.text: "You bite your nails."

links.title: Annette: ""And you knew this from me keeping..."
links.text: "And you knew this from me keeping my hands folded?" She shoots you a suspicious glance.

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: Annette: ""Well... that proves nothing! Anyon..."
links.text: "Well... that proves nothing! Anyone could do an easy deduction like that!" Her eyes flash with defiance. She's not impressed.

links.title: Suggestion: "She actually is impressed, this is..."
links.text: She actually is impressed, this is more like a defensive reflex.

links.title: You: ""Want more? Bet I can figure out *w..."
links.text: "Want more? Bet I can figure out *why* you bite your nails. I got a few reasons in mind."

links.title: Annette: "She nods -- half provocative, half..."
links.text: She nods -- half provocative, half enthusiastic.

links.title: You: ""You're uptight because of your mot..."
links.text: "You're uptight because of your mother and the pressure she's putting on you."

links.title: Annette: "Dismay flickers in her eyes. "Maybe..."
links.text: Dismay flickers in her eyes. "Maybe so, sir." She sighs. "Okay, I know, it's a bad habit and I shouldn't."

links.title: You: ""Either way, another *ace* deductio..."
links.text: "Either way, another *ace* deduction by the #1 detective in town."

links.title: Annette: ""It was okay, sir." She's still got..."
links.text: "It was okay, sir." She's still got a rebellious streak.

links.title: Composure: "There's more that can be achieved h..."
links.text: There's more that can be achieved here. Ask her to do the same.

links.title: You: ""That was a master class move. What..."
links.text: "That was a master class move. Whatever, kid, I don't need to prove myself to you."

links.title: Annette: ""If you say so, sir." She grins vic..."
links.text: "If you say so, sir." She grins victoriously.

links.title: You: ""I hope this entertained you.""
links.text: "I hope this entertained you."

links.title: You: ""Rats have been nibbling on your fi..."
links.text: "Rats have been nibbling on your fingers. Child labour in dismal working conditions..."

links.title: Annette: ""What rats? I just read books. Have..."
links.text: "What rats? I just read books. Haven't seen a rat in this building in forever."

links.title: You: ""No rats in this dilapidated buildi..."
links.text: "No rats in this dilapidated building? Strange."

links.title: Annette: ""Maybe they're just afraid... of bo..."
links.text: "Maybe they're just afraid... of books!" She laughs, with a slight nervous undertone.

links.title: You: ""Chewed-on-nails... means you're re..."
links.text: "Chewed-on-nails... means you're recycling your body material."

links.title: Annette: ""That is so gross.""
links.text: "That is so gross."

links.title: You: ""Life is gross. So very gross.""
links.text: "Life is gross. So very gross."

links.title: Annette: ""Eww." She shudders."
links.text: "Eww." She shudders.

links.title: You: ""It's an intense dedication to the..."
links.text: "It's an intense dedication to the Way of Business. There are no riches without personal sacrifice."

links.title: Annette: ""Thank you, sir! I work hard." She..."
links.text: "Thank you, sir! I work hard." She beams a smile.

links.title: You: ""You think so? Fine, do better -- d..."
links.text: "You think so? Fine, do better -- deduce something about me."

links.title: Annette: ""You're quite sober." She snaps bac..."
links.text: "You're quite sober." She snaps back quickly.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant does not flinch at t..."
links.text: The lieutenant does not flinch at the comment. He does not flinch even a single bit. He is intensely not flinching. It takes effort.

links.title: You: ""Wait... How do you know I'm usuall..."
links.text: "Wait... How do you know I'm usually not?"

links.title: Annette: ""Because you usually aren't.""
links.text: "Because you usually aren't."

links.title: You: ""Yeah, about that... maybe you coul..."
links.text: "Yeah, about that... maybe you could point me toward some booze?"

links.title: Annette: ""Uhm... Frittte, maybe?" She shrugs..."
links.text: "Uhm... Frittte, maybe?" She shrugs, a compassionate look in her eyes. "Alcohol is not good for you, sir."

links.title: Annette: "There she stands, swaying on her fe..."
links.text: There she stands, swaying on her feet, assaulted by the early spring breeze. She smiles at you. The whole situation suddenly feels familiar, somehow.

links.title: Logic: "There's something you're missing..."
links.text: There's something you're missing...

links.title: You: ""And I'm having a grand time!""
links.text: "And I'm having a grand time!"

links.title: Annette: ""I sure hope you are, sir!" She rub..."
links.text: "I sure hope you are, sir!" She rubs her red nose.

links.title: You: ""I am also sad and my head hurts.""
links.text: "I am also sad and my head hurts."

links.title: Annette: ""I'm sorry, sir. I hope things get..."
links.text: "I'm sorry, sir. I hope things get better soon." She looks you in the eye, a gleam of sympathy on her face.

links.title: You: ""There were a few other hints...""
links.text: "There were a few other hints..."

links.title: You: ""It's super simple for a detective..."
links.text: "It's super simple for a detective such as myself."

links.title: Composure: "You fail to deduce anything substan..."
links.text: You fail to deduce anything substantial.

links.title: Annette: "She waits intently."
links.text: She waits intently.

links.title: You: ""I'm a detective. I deduce that you..."
links.text: "I'm a detective. I deduce that you... are a girl."

links.title: Annette: ""Come on, anyone would notice that!..."
links.text: "Come on, anyone would notice that!" She rolls her eyes.

links.title: You: ""I'm a detective. I deduce that......"
links.text: "I'm a detective. I deduce that... You are very small."

links.title: Annette: ""Come on, don't be silly. That's no..."
links.text: "Come on, don't be silly. That's not a proper deduction." She rolls her eyes.

links.title: You: ""Actually, I... I... I'm sorry... I..."
links.text: "Actually, I... I... I'm sorry... I can't deduce anything.

links.title: Annette: "A small disappointment rolls over h..."
links.text: A small disappointment rolls over her, but she promptly gets over it and says: "It's okay, sir."

links.title: Empathy: "You disappointed a small child. Wel..."
links.text: You disappointed a small child. Well done, champ.

links.title: You: "What are you missing here? Why does..."
links.text: What are you missing here? Why does this feel familiar?

links.title: Suggestion: "Because you know each other. She's..."
links.text: Because you know each other. She's been talking to you so openly because you've talked before.

links.title: You: ""Hang on. So you... know me? We've..."
links.text: "Hang on. So you... know me? We've met before?"

links.title: Annette: ""Yes! I used to stand out there all..."
links.text: "Yes! I used to stand out there all the time, before mother told me to focus on my homework."

links.title: Annette: ""You've been running around for sev..."
links.text: "You've been running around for several days, talking about small churches and how everyone betrayed you, sir."

links.title: You: ""Did I ever talk to you?""
links.text: "Did I ever talk to you?"

links.title: Annette: ""Of course. You stopped by a few ti..."
links.text: "Of course. You stopped by a few times." She looks at you intently. "You certainly look better than the last time I saw you!"

links.title: You: ""I doubt that.""
links.text: "I doubt that."

links.title: Annette: ""No, you don't have party eyes anym..."
links.text: "No, you don't have party eyes anymore."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant slowly -- ever so sl..."
links.text: The lieutenant slowly -- ever so slowly -- realizes something. "Party eyes. Yes, of course. That makes sense."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "I'm not surprised children have see..."
links.text: I'm not surprised children have seen you running around with *party eyes* on, he thinks. Not at all.

links.title: You: ""*Party eyes*?""
links.text: "*Party eyes*?"

links.title: Annette: ""You know... like a cat in the dark..."
links.text: "You know... like a cat in the dark! All big-and-wide-eyed." She giggles at the thought. "It certainly looks odd on a man."

links.title: Composure: "The swivelling eyes of a loony drug..."
links.text: The swivelling eyes of a loony drug addict. That is what she meant. You were probably gurning too.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Good thing she's didn't say PARTY E..."
links.text: Good thing she's didn't say PARTY EYES loud, her mother's nearby...

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Fuck yeah! You should get some part..."
links.text: Fuck yeah! You should get some party eyes right now! Snap those sequins on you, boy.

links.title: You: "Does that mean... I've been partaki..."
links.text: Does that mean... I've been partaking in *narcotics*?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Oh baby, that's not what you have t..."
links.text: Oh baby, that's not what you have to worry about. Worry about the important thing!

links.title: You: "The girl doesn't know what she's ta..."
links.text: The girl doesn't know what she's talking about! Forget about this.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Don't leave us hanging like that, m..."
links.text: Don't leave us hanging like that, man. Open yourself to the experiences of the world, expand your consciousness. With amphetamines.

links.title: You: ""So... why didn't you tell me you k..."
links.text: "So... why didn't you tell me you knew me to begin with?"

links.title: Annette: ""I didn't know I had to do that." S..."
links.text: "I didn't know I had to do that." She looks puzzled.

links.title: You: ""I don't really like this detective..."
links.text: "I don't really like this detective-deduction game anymore..." (Conclude.)

links.title: Annette: "She gives you a rather concerned lo..."
links.text: She gives you a rather concerned look. "I guess we can change the subject, sir. I didn't mean to bring you down."

links.title: You: ""Thanks -- I've learned something a..."
links.text: "Thanks -- I've learned something about myself today." (Conclude.)

links.title: Annette: ""I'm glad I could help you, sir." S..."
links.text: "I'm glad I could help you, sir." She smiles a wide, helpful smile.

links.title: You: ""What do you mean better? I look li..."
links.text: "What do you mean better? I look like shit."

links.title: Annette: ""Yeah, but you don't have party eye..."
links.text: "Yeah, but you don't have party eyes anymore."

links.title: You: ""Thanks. I'm trying.""
links.text: "Thanks. I'm trying."

links.title: Annette: ""Yeah, I can see. You don't have pa..."
links.text: "Yeah, I can see. You don't have party eyes anymore."

links.title: Annette: ""Yes! I stand in this spot all the..."
links.text: "Yes! I stand in this spot all the time." She sways back and forth on her feet.

links.title: You: ""On second thought, maybe I shouldn..."
links.text: "On second thought, maybe I shouldn't remember. Maybe there's a reason I forgot."

links.title: Annette: ""Yes, sir." The girl looks at you q..."
links.text: "Yes, sir." The girl looks at you quizzically. "Maybe you are interested in books?"

links.title: Suggestion: "You have absolutely no idea. Famili..."
links.text: You have absolutely no idea. Familiar how? You must have forgotten something you heard again.

links.title: You: ""I gotta go." [Leave]"
links.text: "I gotta go." [Leave]

dialogueTree.title: Annette: ""I'm sorry, sir, I can't talk right..."
dialogueTree.text: "I'm sorry, sir, I can't talk right now. I'm very busy with my homework... I have so much homework now."

links.title: Empathy: "You just can't win."
links.text: You just can't win.

links.title: Logic: "Out of the rain and into the gutter..."
links.text: Out of the rain and into the gutter.

dialogueTree.title: Annette: ""Hello, sir. How is the investigati..."
dialogueTree.text: "Hello, sir. How is the investigation going? Found any *cuuurses* yet?"

links.title: You: ""Yeah, I found a way into the Doome..."
links.text: "Yeah, I found a way into the Doomed Commercial Area."

links.title: Annette: ""Oh, that's great!" Her smile is wa..."
links.text: "Oh, that's great!" Her smile is warm. "I hope exciting adventures lie ahead! And maybe you can help mother become... less afraid."

links.title: You: ""I can't get into the Doomed Commer..."
links.text: "I can't get into the Doomed Commercial Area. Your mother won't let me through the back door."

links.title: Annette: ""Mhm. Mum can get really agitated a..."
links.text: "Mhm. Mum can get really agitated about that." She sways on her feet. "I guess you can try making her less afraid somehow... then she might trust you."

links.title: You: ""It's going fine, I think.""
links.text: "It's going fine, I think."

links.title: Annette: ""That's very good to hear." She fli..."
links.text: "That's very good to hear." She flicks you a thumbs up. "You'll get to the bottom of this in no time! Just like a detective in the stories."

links.title: You: ""It's going bad, *really* bad.""
links.text: "It's going bad, *really* bad."

links.title: Annette: ""Oh, that's very sad to hear." She..."
links.text: "Oh, that's very sad to hear." She frowns. "But it'll pick up soon, don't worry. There's always a... bad spot in the stories, right before the detective figures things out."

dialogueTree.title: Annette: ""The lights are so pretty when it g..."
dialogueTree.text: "The lights are so pretty when it gets dark." She scans the surrounding buildings, a happy look on her face.

dialogueTree.title: Annette: ""Every snowflake is like a little g..."
dialogueTree.text: "Every snowflake is like a little gift from the sky." She shivers as one falls on her nose.

dialogueTree.title: Annette: ""Hello again, sir!" The girl is sip..."
dialogueTree.text: "Hello again, sir!" The girl is sipping on her hot juice. She looks at you with shy amusement.

dialogueTree.title: Annette: ""Hello again, sir! Are you interest..."
dialogueTree.text: "Hello again, sir! Are you interested in a new and exciting book this time?" She sways slowly on her feet.

links.title: You: ""What kind of a store is this anywa..."
links.text: "What kind of a store is this anyway?"

links.title: Annette: ""It's a bookstore, sir! We sell boo..."
links.text: "It's a bookstore, sir! We sell books, postcards, and some board games." She points at the window. "It's called *Crime, Romance, and Biographies of Famous People*."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Whoah! WHOAH-WHOAH-WHOAH! Hold your..."
links.text: Whoah! WHOAH-WHOAH-WHOAH! Hold your horses little girl!

links.title: You: ""What is a book?""
links.text: "What is a book?"

links.title: Annette: ""That is a book." She points at the..."
links.text: "That is a book." She points at the stands. "They have stories inside them -- it's like someone told you a story in a really long letter."

links.title: Empathy: "She is unfazed by your questions. S..."
links.text: She is unfazed by your questions. She would consider it impolite to point out any perceived weirdness.

links.title: You: ""What's a postcard?""
links.text: "What's a postcard?"

links.title: Annette: ""A postcard," she observes you for..."
links.text: "A postcard," she observes you for a moment, "is a small cardboard picture. You can write a few words on the other side and send it to your friend or your *beloved*."

links.title: You: ""What's a board... game?""
links.text: "What's a board... game?"

links.title: Annette: ""Board games are like little games..."
links.text: "Board games are like little games on a table, made to pass the time... There are several different ones." She pauses to ponder. "But sailors here mostly buy cards."

links.title: You: ""Interesting. Thanks.""
links.text: "Interesting. Thanks."

links.title: Annette: ""My pleasure! Anything else you'd l..."
links.text: "My pleasure! Anything else you'd like to know?"

links.title: You: "Don't be ridiculous, I know all the..."
links.text: Don't be ridiculous, I know all these things.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "You're fooling nobody."
links.text: You're fooling nobody.

links.title: You: "Don't you sass me."
links.text: Don't you sass me.

links.title: Annette: ""Sir? Are you okay?" Her voice sudd..."
links.text: "Sir? Are you okay?" Her voice suddenly reaches your mind. "You've been standing here silently for a while now..."

links.title: You: "I said I know all of these things a..."
links.text: I said I know all of these things and I do, god dammit.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Pfft... books? Postcards? Easy! Eve..."
links.text: Pfft... books? Postcards? Easy! Even a kid would know all of this.

links.title: You: ""Little girl, I know what a book is..."
links.text: "Little girl, I know what a book is. Books are like very long letters, with stories inside them."

links.title: Annette: ""Yes!" She nods, smiling. "That's e..."
links.text: "Yes!" She nods, smiling. "That's exactly it."

links.title: You: ""I also know what a postcard is......"
links.text: "I also know what a postcard is... it's a small cardboard picture that you can send to a friend or a loved one."

links.title: Annette: ""Mhm mhm. You've got it, sir. What..."
links.text: "Mhm mhm. You've got it, sir. What about board games?"

links.title: You: ""Who cares about board games? No on..."
links.text: "Who cares about board games? No one."

links.title: Annette: ""Okay, sir. This was all very... *e..."
links.text: "Okay, sir. This was all very... *enlightening*. Can I help you with anything else?"

links.title: You: ""The police don't have time for gam..."
links.text: "The police don't have time for games."

links.title: You: ""I like playing games... with peopl..."
links.text: "I like playing games... with peoples' minds."

links.title: You: ""Alright, I think that was enough...."
links.text: "Alright, I think that was enough. I have proven myself."

links.title: Annette: ""If you say so, sir. Can I help you..."
links.text: "If you say so, sir. Can I help you with anything else?"

links.title: You: "Nah, it feels inappropriate to lect..."
links.text: Nah, it feels inappropriate to lecture this girl.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Don't be a fool -- as an expert, it..."
links.text: Don't be a fool -- as an expert, it's your duty to tell what you know to everyone.

links.title: You: "Don't tell me what to do."
links.text: Don't tell me what to do.

links.title: Annette: ""Sir? Are you okay?" Her voice sudd..."
links.text: "Sir? Are you okay?" Her voice suddenly reaches your mind. "You've been standing here silently for a while now..."

links.title: You: "Hey now, I already made up my mind."
links.text: Hey now, I already made up my mind.

links.title: You: ""Is it okay if I ask you some quest..."
links.text: "Is it okay if I ask you some questions?"

links.title: Annette: ""Okay, sir. I'll try to answer any..."
links.text: "Okay, sir. I'll try to answer any questions you have. I hope they're about books."

links.title: You: ""Not really." [Leave.]"
links.text: "Not really." [Leave.]

dialogueTree.title: Annette: ""Hello, sir! Step right in, the sto..."
dialogueTree.text: "Hello, sir! Step right in, the store is open!" A young girl with chubby red cheeks waves at you, smiling. Her nose is also red from the cold.

links.title: You: ""Hello.""
links.text: "Hello."

links.title: Annette: ""Are you interested in a new and ex..."
links.text: "Are you interested in a new and exciting book?" She stomps her feet to feel warmer.

links.title: You: ""I am the law.""
links.text: "I am the law."

links.title: Annette: ""I know, sir." She stomps her feet..."
links.text: "I know, sir." She stomps her feet to feel warmer.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Everyone understands you're *the l..."
links.text: "Everyone understands you're *the law*. That's why you have that insignia on your arm. So you don't have to keep saying it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, people get that you are *the..."
links.text: "Yes, people get that you are *the law*. You really don't have to keep saying it."

links.title: You: ""Hi.""
links.text: "Hi."
